Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, a clumsy sketch drawing of a royal head with hieroglyphs above on one side. Perhaps a fake.
Curator's comments: Extremely simple or clumsy drawings of human or royal heads are well known among the figured ostraca, cf. for example O. Cairo 25157 and O Stockholm MM 14139 and 14140; for similar ostraca from Th. M. Davis's excavations 1905/6, cf. C.N. Reeves, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 40 (1984), pl. 33b.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (391906) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/391906)
Acquisition notes: Rustafjaell collection, Sotheby sale 19-21 December 1906, lot 277
